Others: The Dallas Mavericks lost their fourth straight game, all in the clutch, this time to the Utah Jazz.
Jason Kidd decided to shake up the starting lineup, rolling with Luka Doncic, Quentin Grimes, Klay Thompson, Maxi Kleber, and Dereck Lively II.
Utah started Collin Sexton, Keyonte George, Lauri Markkanen, Kyle Filipowski, and John Collins.
Dallas' offense couldn't take advantage of Utah's start, and the Jazz started to chip away toward the end of the first quarter.
Luka Doncic led all players with 37 points and nine assists, but he also turned it over three times.
John Collins led the Jazz with 28 points and nine rebounds.
